jobTitle: Demand Planner - SAP, Microsoft Office, Forecasting
description:
Demand Planner II

Position Overview

The Demand Planner is responsible for creating and maintaining accurate demand forecasts for our products, ensuring that inventory levels are optimized and customer demand is met. The successful candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams to drive inventory optimization strategies, and will provide insights to support decision making.

Prior experience in a Manufacturing environment highly desired.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain demand forecasts for our products, using historical sales data, customer inputs, and market trends.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to develop inventory optimization strategies, balancing inventory levels with customer demand.
  • Analyze demand trends and provide insights and recommendations to support supply chain planning and decision-making.
  • Collaborate with production planning teams to ensure timely delivery of products to customers.
  • Monitor and manage back orders, ensuring timely fulfillment of customer orders.
  • Contribute to the development and optimization of sales forecasting and production planning processes.
  • Utilize SAP and ERP systems to manage inventory levels and forecast accuracy.
  • Perform data analysis to support demand planning and inventory management.
  • Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures, and contribute to the development of new policies and procedures as needed.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, business administration, or related field.
  • 3-5 years of experience in demand planning, inventory management, or related field.
  • Experience working with SAP and other ERP systems.
  • Experience with forecasting, production planning, and sales forecasting.
  • Strong analytical and data analysis skills.
  • Excellent Microsoft Office skills, especially Excel.
  • Experience in manufacturing or appliance industry preferred.
  • Experience in logistics and supply chain management preferred.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Benefits

  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Long-term Disability Benefits
  • 401k 100% match up to 4%
  • Profit Sharing
  • 2 weeks Paid Vacation
  • 40 hours paid personal leave
  • 12 paid holidays
  • Company discounts on products
  • Ongoing product training, uniforms, company tablet, cell phone, and vehicle for eligible positions
